name: New York Knish - Yo!
author: Cathy Johnston
summary: Looking for that New York knish?  Well, this is pretty darn close!  This will take you right back to the streets of New York!
directions: Place potatoes into a pot with enough water to cover
Bring to a boil, and cook until tender
While the potatoes are boiling, heat 1/4 cup butter in a large skillet over medium heat
Stir in onions, and cook until soft and translucent
In a large bowl, mash the potatoes until smooth
Mix in onion and butter mixture, crumbled bouillon, and salt and pepper to taste
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Layer 3 sheets of phyllo dough one on top of the other, and cut this triple-layered sheet in half
Drop one spoonful of potato mixture into each phyllo piece
Roll dough around mixture, tucking ends under
Repeat this step with remaining sheets of phyllo dough to make 12 knishes
Brush with remaining 1/4 cup butter, and place on baking sheet
Bake in a preheated oven 30 to 40 minutes, or until golden brown
